block.para: Shows how to use the &JSBlong; to build a React application that uses &TEXTRACTlong; to extract data from a document image and display it in an interactive web page. This example runs in a web browser and requires an authenticated &COGlong; identity for credentials. It uses &S3long; (&S3;) for storage, and for notifications it polls an &SQSlong; (&SQS;) queue that is subscribed to an &SNSlong; (&SNS;) topic.
For complete source code and instructions on how to set up and run, see the full example on GitHub.
